name: Make sure you are using Secure option for cookies so that Cross-Site-Scripting attacks can be prevented
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path
Make sure to accurately define the path of the web application/s for which this cookie is valid
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Javascript)
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks (Vue.js)
Avoid creating cookie with overly broad domain (Vue.js)

Avoid creating cookie with overly broad domain (AngularJS)

Ensure you have enable SSL verification in node-curl

Make sure to accurately define the path of the web application/s for which this cookie is valid
Make sure you are using Secure option for cookies so that Cross-Site-Scripting attacks can be prevented
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Ensure you have enable SSL verification in node-curl
Ensure you don't compare passwords against hard-coded strings in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (C#)
Ensure you are not using "referer" header field in HTTP request
Always set an expiration time for an Http Session to improve security
Ensure cleaning the cookies during the logout to avoid them to be used by another web application

Ensure you set the time out to less than 5 min or less.
Ensure you have not disable AntiForgery token in Razor Pages (ASP.NET Core MVC)
